title: Protection visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 866 Protection visa for people who legally arrived in Australia and seek asylum. It outlines eligibility, costs, processing, family inclusion rules, obligations, travel conditions, and rights granted by the visa. The visa allows permanent stay if Australia’s protection obligations are engaged.

visa_details.description: Permanent visa for people who arrived in Australia on a valid visa and seek asylum. Grants permanent stay if Australia’s protection obligations are engaged.
visa_details.purpose: Protection for genuine asylum seekers who arrived legally in Australia.

warnings: Big changes are here to stop people misusing protection visas.
Protection visas are for genuine asylum seekers.
support_links: Online tool to check if the Protection visa is appropriate

benefits_with_this_visa: Live, work and study in Australia permanently
Access government services such as Medicare and Centrelink
Sponsor eligible family members for permanent residence through the offshore Humanitarian Program
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years from visa grant date
Become an Australian citizen if eligible
Attend free English language classes if eligible

notes: Processing is complex and may take some time.
Applicants can assist by responding quickly to information requests.
factors_that_delay_processing: Slow response times to department requests

main_requirements: Must engage Australia’s protection obligations (or be a member of the same family unit of someone who does).
Must have arrived legally in Australia holding a valid visa.
Must meet health, character and security requirements.

must_have: Arrived holding a visa that was in effect
arrival_requirements.legal_reference: Immigration clearance is defined in section 172 of the Migration Act 1958.

requirements: All family members must be in Australia at time of application
All must be eligible to apply

definition_of_family_unit.family_head: Can be the applicant or another member of the family applying.
members: Spouse or de facto partner of the family head
Dependent child or step-child of the family head
Dependent child or step-child of the partner

age_18_or_over_if: Incapacitated for work due to loss of bodily or mental functions
Wholly or substantially reliant on parent/step-parent for financial, psychological, or physical support

dependent_relative_criteria: Must not have a spouse or de facto partner
Usually lives with the family head
Wholly or substantially reliant on the family head for support

required_actions: Complete Form 1022 Notification of change of circumstances
Provide clear color copy of original birth certificate
Attach documents in ImmiAccount or send by post
notes: Certified copy required if sent by post.
Child born in Australia automatically receives same visa as parents unless one parent is an Australian citizen or permanent resident, in which case child may be an Australian citizen by birth.

application_requirements.apply_from: Must be in Australia at time of application
help_with_visa: Information available on who can help with visa applications
Free legal help available for Protection visa applicants

obligations: You and your family members must obey all Australian laws.

travel_rights: Travel to and from Australia for 5 years from visa grant date
After 5 years, must apply for Resident Return visa (subclass 155 or 157) to re-enter Australia
recommendations: Do not use passport or travel document issued by home country, as it may lead to visa cancellation

condition_8559.description: Must not enter the country from which protection was granted without written approval.
approval_requirements: Approval must be granted in writing before travel
Only given for compassionate or compelling circumstances
consequences_of_breach: Possible cancellation of visas of family members

visa_label.notes: No physical visa label placed in travel document.
